questions.question_text:
Universal Containers wants to import an external knowledge base to Lightning Knowledge using the Knowledge Importer.
How should this be implemented? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Article Record Types will be created as part of the import.
choices.A: Each Article Record Type must be in a separate CSV.
choices.D: Multiple Article Record Types can be imported in the same CSV.
choices.B: Article Record Types must be created before the import.

comments.content:
Hi, I am not sure about your answer as it's different in the two comments you posted.
By the way, this article here https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.knowledge_article_importer.htm&type=5 says that "In Lightning Knowledge, you can import articles of multiple record types at once." It should be at the second bullet point.

I d'say it's B and D.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Record types are usually associated with articles individually during the import process, so you would typically specify the record type for each article in the CSV file or create the record types before the import, as mentioned in options B and C.

Selected Answer: AB
Record types are usually associated with articles individually during the import process, so you would typically specify the record type for each article in the CSV file or create the record types before the import, as mentioned in options B and C.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers is migrating from Classic Knowledge to Lightning Knowledge using the Lightning Knowledge Migration Tool and noticed that none of the Article file attachments were migrated.
How can a consultant migrate the file attachments?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
It's B: Files—Files from custom file fields in Classic Knowledge articles are moved to the standard Files object. After migration, view and attach files in the Files related list.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.knowledge_migration_tool_learn.htm&type=5

B is correct. Lightning knowledge guide:
"Files in custom File fields in Salesforce Classic aren’t supported in Lightning Experience. Instead, use the Files related list in Lightning Experience. Use the Lightning Knowledge Migration Tool to move Files from File fields to the Files object and related lists in Lightning Experience."

Selected Answer: D
Option D can ensure that the file attachments previously associated with your Classic Knowledge articles are correctly linked to the corresponding Lightning Knowledge articles. This allows you to maintain the integrity of your knowledge base during the migration process.

choices.C: Post the Files to the Chatter Feed on each Article.
choices.D: Upload the files as Documents, then relate them to the migrated Articles.
choices.A: Use the Lightning Knowledge Migration Tool and choose 'include files'.
choices.B: Use the Files Related List on each article to add files to your articles.

choices.D: Create a single data category group for each division and provide access using the role hierarchy.
choices.C: Create a sharing rule for each division to provide access based on criteria of the article.
choices.B: Create a sharing rule for each division to provide access using the role hierarchy.
choices.A: Create separate data category groups for each division and assign the category to a division profile.

Which solution should a consultant recommend to meet this requirement?
